ANCESTRY.ApplyError: You may only apply an ancestry to a level 0 character with no spent skill or ability points.
ANCESTRY.AbilityHint: Select one primary Ability Score begins at 3 and a secondary Ability Score which begins at 2.
ANCESTRY.AbilityWarning: The primary and secondary abilities for an ancestry may not be the same.
ANCESTRY.ResistanceHint: This ancestry may have a biological Resistance (+5) and Vulnerability (-5) to two damage types. An ancestry may not have a resistance without also having a vulnerability.
ANCESTRY.ResistanceWarning: You must choose both a resistance and a vulnerability if you select either.
ACTION.WarningCannotUseTag: {name} cannot use action {action} which requires tag {tag}!
ACTION.WarningCannotSpendAction: {name} cannot spend Action because they are Paralyzed!
ACTION.WarningCannotSpendFocus: {name} cannot spend Focus because they are currently {status}!
ACTION.WarningInvalidTarget: You must designate at least one {type} target for {action}!
ACTION.WarningIncorrectTargets: You may only designate up to {number} {type} targets for {action}!
ACTION.WarningRequireTemplate: You must place a Measured Template to indicate the area of effect of {action}.
ACTION.TagDeadlyTooltip: This action has the potential to deal a tremendous amount of damage, increasing the damage multiplier for any damage dealt by x1.
ACTION.TagDifficultTooltip: This action is complicated or challenging to perform. You incur 2 additional banes when attempting the action.
ACTION.TagDualWieldTooltip: This action requires wielding two separate weapons or being entirely unarmed to perform.
ACTION.TagEmpoweredTooltip: This action is powerful and deals additional damage, gaining a +2 damage bonus if successful.
ACTION.TagAccurateTooltip: This action is particularly accurate. You gain 2 additional Boons when performing the action.
ACTION.TagFinesseTooltip: This action requires a certain amount of finesse to perform. You must be wielding a weapon which scales using Dexterity.
ACTION.TagFlankingTooltip: This action may only be performed against a flanked or unaware target.
ACTION.TagFreehandTooltip: This action requires at least one hand which is not currently holding an object to perform.
ACTION.TagHeavyTooltip: This action requires physical power to perform. You must be wielding a weapon which scales using Strength.
ACTION.TagHarmlessTooltip: This action does not impose a directly harmful effect, its damage multiplier is zero.
ACTION.TagHealingTooltip: This action provides restoration by testing an ally's Wounds threshold.
ACTION.TagWeakenedTooltip: This action is weaker than normal attacks and has a -2 damage bonus.
ACTION.TagMechanicalTooltip: This action requires use of a mechanical weapon.
ACTION.TagMeleeTooltip: This action requires wielding a melee weapon or being unarmed to perform.
ACTION.TagMainHandTooltip: This action utilizes your main-hand weapon to make an attack.
ACTION.TagMovementTooltip: This action allows you to move as part of its activation, including a reduced action point cost for a free movement action per round.
ACTION.TagOneHandTooltip: This action requires wielding a one-handed weapon.
ACTION.TagProjectileTooltip: This action requires use of a projectile weapon.
ACTION.TagRallyingTooltip: This action provides restoration by testing an ally's Madness threshold.
ACTION.TagRangedTooltip: This action requires wielding a ranged weapon to perform.
ACTION.TagReactionTooltip: This action can only be performed during some other creature's turn when its activation condition is met.
ACTION.TagReloadTooltip: This action reloads a ranged weapon which requires reloading.
ACTION.TagShieldTooltip: This action requires wielding a shield to perform.
ACTION.TagSkillTooltip: This action involves a targeted or opposed Skill check.
ACTION.TagSummonTooltip: This action summons, calls, or otherwise creates a combatant which joins the encounter.
ACTION.TagTwoHandedTooltip: This action requires wielding a two-handed weapon to perform.
ACTION.TagOffHandTooltip: This action utilizes your off-hand weapon to make an attack.
ACTION.TagUnarmedTooltip: This action requires you to be fully unarmed in order to perform.
ACTION.TagUnarmoredTooltip: This action requires you to be unarmored in order to perform.
ACTION.TagTargetTooltip: The target type, distance, and number which applies to this action.
ACTION.TagCostTooltip: The Action Point or Focus Point cost of using this action.
ARCHETYPE.AbilitiesHint: Define how the ability scores for creatures of this Archetype scale as they advance in level. Allocate 18 points across all Ability scores. Each ability score must be between zero and 8. Scores with a lower value advance more frequently. For example a score with the value of 2 will increase every 2nd level while a score with a value of 5 will advance every 5 levels.
ARCHETYPE.AddTalentHint: Add a talent to this Archetype by dragging and dropping from the Talents compendium pack.
BACKGROUND.AddTalentHint: Add a talent to this Background by dragging and dropping from the Talents compendium pack.
BACKGROUND.ApplyError: You may only apply a background to a level 0 character with no spent skill points.
BACKGROUND.SkillsError: You must choose exactly four skills as background specializations.
BACKGROUND.SkillsHint: Choose four skills which were acquired as part of your background, each of which will begin at Novice rank.
BACKGROUND.TalentNumberError: A Background may contain a maximum of one starting Talent.
BACKGROUND.TalentTierError: Backgrounds may only offer Tier 0 starting Talents.
COMBAT.WarningCannotChangeRound: Only a Gamemaster user may change the Combat round.
EFFECT.StatusFlankedDescription: You are flanked by multiple enemies who gain additional Boons to their attacks!
KEYBINDINGS.ConfirmActionHint: Confirm actions recorded within the last 60 seconds in the order in which they were taken.
RULER.CannotAffordMove: You cannot afford to move {distance} spaces which costs {action} Action points.
SETTINGS.AutoConfirmHint: Enable auto-confirmation of actions in combat which do not deal damage or cause active effects. This can speed things up but is not recommended during play-testing.
SKILL.RANKS.UntrainedHint: You have no formal training in this area. Any success you have in applying this skill is due to common sense or luck.
SKILL.RANKS.UnspecializedHint: You have not yet attained a specialization path for this skill.
SKILL.RANKS.NoviceHint: You have some formal training or practical experience in the fundamental applications of this skill.
SKILL.RANKS.ApprenticeHint: You have refined and honed the techniques of this skill to a strong functional competence.
SKILL.RANKS.SpecialistHint: Your proficiency with this skill is heightened by expertise in an advanced specialization path.
SKILL.RANKS.AdeptHint: You are a subject matter expert and fluent in all base competencies and applications of this skill.
SKILL.RANKS.MasterHint: You are peerless in your mastery of this skill and of your advanced specialization path.
SKILL.CATEGORY.ExplorationHint: Exploration skills pertain to navigation and traversal of the world.
SKILL.ChoosePath: You must choose a specialization path before advancing this Skill further.
SKILL.CantAfford: You cannot afford to increase this skill. The next rank costs {cost} points and you have {points} skill points available.
TALENT.WARNINGS.AlreadyOwned: You already own {name} and cannot add it a second time.
TALENT.WARNINGS.Banned: You cannot purchase additional Signature talents at this node or tier.
TALENT.WARNINGS.CannotAfford: You do not have sufficient Talent points to purchase {name} which costs {cost} points.
TALENT.WARNINGS.Inaccessible: You are unable to acquire "{name}" because you have not unlocked this talent tree node.
TALENT.WARNINGS.Locked: You do not satisfy the requirements to acquire "{name}" which requires {requires} {requirement}.
TAXONOMY.AbilitiesHint: Define the initial ability scores for creatures with this Taxonomy. Allocate 18 points across all Ability scores. Each ability score must be between zero and 8.
TAXONOMY.ResistancesHint: Define how the resistances and vulnerabilities for creatures of this Taxonomy scale as they advance in level. Assign values to each resistance between -3 (most vulnerable) and +3 (most resistant). Damage types set to zero are neither resistant nor vulnerable. The total across all resistances must sum to zero.
WEAPON.TagAmbushTooltip: This weapon is well-suited to striking before your opponents get a chance to react. When attacking a target lower than you in the initiative order you gain +1 Boon.
WEAPON.TagBlockingTooltip: This weapon provides a bonus to your Block defense.
WEAPON.TagEngagingTooltip: Weapons in this category allow you to better combat multiple foes, increasing your Engagement by +1.
WEAPON.TagKeenTooltip: This weapon is particularly deadly when it achieves a critical hit. IMPORTANT NOTE - the keen property is not yet implemented in the playtest.
WEAPON.TagOversizedTooltip: This item is over-sized or otherwise cumbersome to wield, preventing you from acting quickly. You have +2 banes to Initiative while this item is equipped.
WEAPON.TagParryingTooltip: This weapon provides a bonus to your Parry defense.
WEAPON.TagReachTooltip: This weapon provides a larger than normal effective range. You are able to perform basic Strike attacks at twice your normal range.
WEAPON.TagReloadTooltip: This weapon requires reloading in order to strike. When the weapon is not loaded, any actions which use the weapon cost +1 Action Points.
WEAPON.TagReliableTooltip: This weapon is trustworthy and almost never produces spectacularly bad outcomes. The critical failure threshold of the weapon is reduced by 2 making it less likely that unsuccessful Strikes yield a critical miss.
WEAPON.TagThrownTooltip: This weapon can be thrown, making a normal Strike up to a range of four spaces.
WEAPON.TagVersatileTooltip: This weapon can be wielded with either one or two hands, and switched between these modes without any Action Point cost. While wielded in two hands, the weapon gains an additional +2 base damage but incurs 1 additional Action cost to Strike.
WEAPON.TagDamageTooltip: A shorthand representation of the offensive capabilities of this weapon, expressed as Attack Bonus / Damage Bonus / Damage Multiplier.
WARNING.AbilityCannotIncrease: You cannot increase this Ability further.
WARNING.AbilityCannotDecrease: You cannot decrease this Ability further.
WARNING.AbilityRequireAncestry: You must assign an Ancestry before you can purchase Ability increases.
WARNING.CannotEquipSlotInUse: Actor {actor} cannot equip {item} because the {type} item slot is already in use.
WARNING.CannotEquipActionCost: You cannot equip weaponry because you have no Action points available.
WARNING.CannotEquipInvalidCategory: Actor {actor} cannot use {item} in the {type} equipment slot.
WARNING.SkillRequireAncestryBackground: You must assign both Ancestry and Background before you can purchase Skill ranks.
WALKTHROUGH.AddAncestry: Choose an Ancestry from the Compendium or Items sidebar and add it via drag-and-drop.
WALKTHROUGH.AddBackground: Choose a Background from the Compendium or Items sidebar and add it via drag-and-drop.
WALKTHROUGH.ConfigureArchetype: Configure an Archetype for this adversary.
WALKTHROUGH.ConfigureTaxonomy: Configure a Taxonomy for this adversary.
WALKTHROUGH.AbilityPoints: Spend available Ability Points by increasing your Ability scores.
WALKTHROUGH.SkillPoints: Spend available Skill Points by increasing your Skill ranks.
WALKTHROUGH.TalentPoints: Spend available Talent Points by opening the Talent Tree.
WALKTHROUGH.LevelZero: Complete all character creation steps before advancing your character to Level 1.
WALKTHROUGH.LevelOne: Set your character to Level 1 and begin your adventure!
WALKTHROUGH.LevelUp: You have made enough progress to advance to a new level. Increase your level by one when you are ready!
WALKTHROUGH.LevelZeroIncomplete: You may not advance to Level 1 until you have finished all character creation steps!
